CatDescriptText: Mrs. Dorothy Wells, 7138 Upland Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "I think she should get married. Every girl should get married and it makes no difference what age she is.  A woman who is 45 years of age or over should be entitled to enjoy that type of life as much as a younger girl."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dorothy Wells, wearing light colored dress and cardigan, standing with arms folded in front of marble wall between store windows displaying lamps and jewelry
